Hello everyone,
I am working on customised scrollbar issue : #16468.
I tried two designs
1) Is more consistent with other scrollbars (such as in settings and users section)

2) Is more consistent with night theme

I'd like to go with option 2 as I think it looks better, less distracting and more soothing to eyes (a fact to be considered because other scrollbars hide when inactive, but these will remain visible all time).
Please give your valuable feedback.
@Sumanth Rao your feedback will be really appreciated
Thank you.
I don't use night theme, so I'll abstain from voting here.

@RISHABH D TIWARI These seem to use a different style compared to the scrollbars we use in other places. It would probably be better if we used the same styling here as well. https://github.com/zulip/zulip/commit/adfe4cacc6107e209fb1c6e5151971af44f94c1b may help you - it applied a similar styling to the vertical scrollbar in edit-message view.

I'll surely use the more consistent styles.
Thank you @Sumanth Rao for the resources.
With the recommendation of @Sumanth Rao , I've made changes and generated a PR, please review it #16515

You seem to have other intermediate commits (earlier versions, merge commits, etc) in the PR you linked. https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/contributing/version-control.html#commit-discipline would be a good read and might help you fix up the commits. Also, no need to mention me on each message here :smile:

I have thoroughly read these documentations, and I really tried to adhere to all the commit disciplines.
I did commit squashing for unnecessary commits, but I don't know why that didn't work?
Confused me too.
Maybe the issue is because after squashing, git won't let me push the changes before pulling from remote, and remote has all the commits + new pull commit.

I couldn't figure out how to solve this issue.
It'd be really great if you or anyone could suggest some blog or article to solve this issue.
Thank you
@RISHABH D TIWARI https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/git/ may help

I have corrected the commit,
Please review it and tell if any changes are required.
PR link #16515
Posted a couple of comments on the PR.

Discussion required regarding custom scrollbar for compose box : issue- #16468 pr- #16515 ,
@Anders Kaseorg suggested using simplebar instead of css based ::-webkit-scrollbar,
but the issue is simplebar doesn't support textarea element.
Another library Overlay Scrollbars supports the textarea element.
So should we use another dependency (overlay scrollbars) or stick to the css based approach ?

In my opinion,
We should stick to the css based psuedo scrollbar element as ::-webkit-scrollbar is supported in almost all major browsers like chrome, safari, edge, opera etc. only with exception of firefox
browser compatibility by mdn

the workaround for firefox is to use scrollbar-width : width and scrollbar-color : thumb-color track-background css properties which are supported only by firefox browser. link to mdn webdocs for css scrollbars for firefox

Result using the above mentioned properties

code for desired effect
@RDT I don't think we need a scrollbar on a textarea element for this issue -- why do you think we do?

@Tim Abbott The scrollbar is in textarea.
Screenshot-from-2020-10-15-02-34-52.jpg

or are we talking about some other scrollbar?
The issue is about the compose box preview widget, not the compose box itself.
Please allow me to ask why are we considering only the preview widget when there is same issue with compose box too?
My reasoning is simple: I don’t want us to have more different kinds of scrollbars. Especially not at the expense of extra code using non-standard CSS lacking cross-browser support.
Because SimpleBar doesn’t work on a textarea, the value of trying to restyle the textarea scrollbar doesn’t outweigh the drawbacks.

Anders Kaseorg said:

My reasoning is simple: I don’t want us to have more different kinds of scrollbars. Especially not at the expense of extra code using non-standard CSS lacking cross-browser support.

I agree.

Anders Kaseorg said:

Because SimpleBar doesn’t work on a textarea, the value of trying to restyle the textarea scrollbar doesn’t outweigh the drawbacks.

So would you suggest that we should use simplebar for preview widget and leave the textarea scrollbar as it is?
Correct.

I'll make appropriate changes and generate a new PR.
Thank you for guiding me.
Bsbsvs
@Aakash Verma please use #test here for testing.

I have made appropriate changes and generated a new PR #16557.
Please review it and suggest if any changes required.
Thank you.

The issue #16468 of scrollbar in preview_message_area is changed to use simplebar scrollbar in solved in pr #16557 and merged as commit 03005da thanks to @Tim Abbott .
Should I do the same with other css psuedo scrollbars used as @Sumanth Rao mentioned in here ?
@RDT yes, migrating those to simplebar would be great. Please do one commit per element you're migrating, since we may discover some locations don't make to sense to migrate after looking at it.

Sure.
I'll start right away.
